intro: Psychotria levis, commonly known as the "white psychotria," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale green flowers and elliptical leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Psychotria levis is also noted for its use in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
